_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:28:16 using v2.5
title: How have medication errors causing severe harm or death changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
As with all indicators drawn from incident reporting the observed rates will be influenced by the general reporting level.

Over time, the rate of reported medication errors which resulted in severe harm or death has been declining in the NHS. Between 2008 and 2013 the rate more than halved, from 0.77 to 0.34 per 100,000 population.
